cip.render.raytrace.geometry

Class AGeometry

  • java.lang.Object
    • cip.render.raytrace.geometry.AGeometry
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDynXmlObject, INamedObject, IRtGeometry
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AQuadricGeo, PlanarPolyhedra, XfmGeometry

    public abstract class AGeometry
extends java.lang.Object
implements IDynXmlObject, INamedObject, IRtGeometry
    This is an abstract class for a ray tracing geometry. It offers an implementation of the most common elements of a ray tracing geometry and some functions to help in object parsing.
    Since:
    1.0

      • loadFromXml

        public void loadFromXml(@NotNull
                        @NotNull org.w3c.dom.Element xmlElement,
                        @Nullable
                        @Nullable java.util.LinkedList refObjectList)
                 throws DynXmlObjParseException
        The geometry implementation must override this function to load the geometry from the XML node.
        Specified by:
        loadFromXml in interface IDynXmlObject
        Parameters:
        xmlElement - The dynamically loaded object DOM Document element.
        refObjectList - A linked list if named objects (implementing the INamedObject interface) that have already been loaded and can be used to resolve object references.
        Throws:
        DynXmlObjParseException - Thrown if there was an error parsing the object. If this exception is thrown it should be assumed that this object was incorrectly initialized, is invalid, and should not be used in any further operations.

      • toChildXmlElement

        public void toChildXmlElement(@NotNull
                              @NotNull org.w3c.dom.Element parentEl)
        Create the dynamically loaded object node with attributes and then calls internalToXml(org.w3c.dom.Element). This provides the dynamically loaded XML boilerplate for the object. Derived classes should not override this function, but should override the internalToXml(org.w3c.dom.Element) to add object-specific information to the XML node.
        Specified by:
        toChildXmlElement in interface IDynXmlObject
        Parameters:
        parentEl - The parent element.

      • internalToXml

        protected void internalToXml(org.w3c.dom.Element element)
        Override this function to add object-specific information to an XML node.
        Parameters:
        element - The dynamically loaded object node that the object-specific information should be written into. The loadFromXml(org.w3c.dom.Element, LinkedList) funtcion must be overridden by the geometry implementation to be able to read the object-specific information set by the object here.

      • resolveGeometryRef

        protected IRtGeometry resolveGeometryRef(java.lang.String strName,
                                         java.util.LinkedList refObjectList)
                                  throws DynXmlObjParseException
        Resolve a geometry reference by finding the geometry in the reference object list. This is typically used by the implementation of a geometry that contains other geometries that are specified by reference in the XML geometry specification.
        Parameters:
        strName - The name of the geometry that will be located in the reference object list.
        refObjectList - The reference object list.
        Returns:
        Returns the named geometry from the reference object list.
        Throws:
        DynXmlObjParseException - Thrown if the geometry cannot be found in the reference object list.

      • initSampling

        public void initSampling(int nSample,
                         float[] f1dSample,
                         float[] f1dRandom,
                         Point2f[] pt2dSample,
                         Point2f[] pt2dRandom,
                         Point3f[] pt3dSample,
                         Point3f[] pt3dRandom)
        Description copied from interface: IRtGeometry
        Specifies the sampling arrays that should be used for distributed ray-tracing. Geometries that do not participate in distributed ray-tracing will normally ignore this function, or, pass the arrays down to child geometries which may make use of the sampling arrays. Normally, these are used for motion-blurr in animated objects.
        Specified by:
        initSampling in interface IRtGeometry
        Parameters:
        nSample - The number of subsamples (oversamples) per pixel.
        f1dSample - The 1d sample displacement array. The length of this array will be equal to the number of subsamples per pixel. This array is for oversampling linear phenomena.
        f1dRandom - The 1d 'jitter' array. No assumptions should be made about the length of this array.
        pt2dSample - The 2d sample displacement array. The length of this array will be equal to the number of subsamples per pixel. This array is for oversampling area phenomena.
        pt2dRandom - The 2d 'jitter' array. No assumptions should be made about the length of this array.
        pt3dSample - The 3d sample displacement array. The length of this array will be equal to the number of subsamples per pixel. This array is for oversampling volume phenomena.
        pt3dRandom - The 3d 'jitter' array. No assumptions should be made about the length of this array.

      • isConvex

        public boolean isConvex()
        The default implementation returns false, that the object is not convex.
        Specified by:
        isConvex in interface IRtGeometry
        Returns:
        Returns true if the object is convex and false if the object is not convex or the convexity cannot be verified.

      • getConvexHullVertices

        public Point3f[] getConvexHullVertices()
        The default implementation returns null, that there is no convex hull.
        Specified by:
        getConvexHullVertices in interface IRtGeometry
        Returns:
        Returns the array of convex hull vertices, Returns null if a convex hull cannot be fit to the object. Being unable to fit a convex hull implies that the object must be explicitly queried for intersection on every ray.

      • getBvIntersection

        public boolean getBvIntersection(Bv3fIntersection bvInt,
                                 Line3f ray)
        The default implementation reports that we are in the middle of an infinitely extending bounding volume for the object, so, the object must be tested for intersection.
        Specified by:
        getBvIntersection in interface IRtGeometry
        Parameters:
        bvInt - The bounding volume intersection.
        ray - The ray being tested for intersection with the bounding volume.
        Returns:
        true if the ray intersects the bounding volume and may intersect the object, false if the ray does not intersect the bounding volume and cannot intersect the object.

      • getRayIntersection

        public boolean getRayIntersection(@NotNull
                                  @NotNull RayIntersection intersection,
                                  @NotNull
                                  @NotNull Line3f ray,
                                  boolean bStartsInside,
                                  int nSample,
                                  int nRandom)
        Gets the ray intersection. The default implementation simply returns false, there is no intersection.
        Specified by:
        getRayIntersection in interface IRtGeometry
        Parameters:
        intersection - The intersection of the ray and the surface. The intersection will be either freshly initialized or will contain information about the closest intersection discovered thus far.
        ray - The ray being tesed for intersection.
        bStartsInside - false if this is an outside ray, true if this is a ray spawned from an intersection with this object and on the inside of the object.
        nSample - The pixel sub-sample index. This is used in distributed ray-tracing to make sure the correct sample displacement is used for samples that are distributed.
        nRandom - The jitter array index..
        Returns:
        Returns true if there is an intersection with this object that is closer than the current intersection, and false otherwise.

      • getNaturalCoordinates

        public void getNaturalCoordinates(RayIntersection intersection)
        This is a pseudo-natural mapping that just projects the xy (plan) object coordinates to be the "natural coordinates", and creates the axis aligned and scaled displacement vectors for U and V. This is a linear projection in plan. The UV displacement vectors are simply the projections of the i,j vectors rotated as though the following normal that had initially been axis aligned with the Z axis.
        Specified by:
        getNaturalCoordinates in interface IRtGeometry
        Parameters:
        intersection - The ray intersection.

      • testShadow

        public boolean testShadow(RayIntersection intersection,
                          Vector3f vLight,
                          float fDistLight,
                          IRtLight light,
                          int nSample,
                          int nRandom)
        The default implementation returns false, that there is no cast shadow.
        Specified by:
        testShadow in interface IRtGeometry
        Parameters:
        intersection - The intersection being tested for shadow.
        vLight - The direction from the intersection to the light.
        fDistLight - The distance from the intersection to the light.
        light - The light. This is supplied as an argument in the event an object is both a light source and a geometry and the geometry of the light should not be tested for casting a shadow from that light.
        nSample - The pixel sub-sample index. This is used in distributed ray-tracing to make sure the correct sample displacement is used for samples that are distributed.
        nRandom - The jitter array index.
        Returns:
        Returns true if this object casts a shadow from the light and false otherwise.
